document.title: TEXAS ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS FOR SPANISH LANGUAGE ARTS AND READING AND ENGLISH AS A SECOND LANGUAGE

CE84A711386A4F7CA32C5E7852D9CF6D.description: use an appropriate mode of delivery, whether written, oral, or multimodal, to present results.

3031C5145B654701B6057316E35F2051.description: display academic citations and use source materials ethically; and

24C5CE2B646C41ACB14DB46DAE0BE42A.description: faulty reasoning such as bandwagon appeals, repetition, and loaded language;

10A56902C9A64EA69EA539A4ACE53AB5.description: reliability, credibility, and bias, including omission; and

A50AC28C2E8940B5990084106AFD5635.description: differentiate between paraphrasing and plagiarism when using source materials;

87AC25F6912947B6886D825BBF8AE36A.description: synthesize information from a variety of sources;

53595FCA5B0E4A85BC9CAAD47CF275F4.description: differentiate between primary and secondary sources;

EB22C52C6A6B4568A9A1422DDED3FFF9.description: identify and gather relevant information from a variety of sources;

0A5CC659AAD24C84BED06F0DCF8463F5.description: refine the major research question, if necessary, guided by the answers to a secondary set of questions;

88E6EA99AD874F9B837FCE945CA64F4A.description: generate student-selected and teacher-guided questions for formal and informal inquiry;

3230FE1F1746468EA1D4F299AA7C5C6B.description: Inquiry and research: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. The student engages in both short-term and sustained recursive inquiry processes for a variety of purposes. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

FAF91795214B4E3AAA7403DF10DE6489.description: compose correspondence that reflects an opinion, registers a complaint, or requests information in a business or friendly structure.

DAE86112D0E54D158F001BB3A31BAE7A.description: compose multi-paragraph argumentative texts using genre characteristics and craft; and

FAC8E384F6034FE7AB6B6F9C586E7449.description: compose informational texts, including multi-paragraph essays that convey information about a topic, using a clear controlling idea or thesis statement and genre characteristics and craft;

2499E40D83B6470D94B55E6E3D2E60CD.description: compose literary texts such as personal narratives, fiction, and poetry using genre characteristics and craft;

DA3E6A86A9D7426BB3DA1C5DAFBBEA1A.description: Composition: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--genres. The student uses genre characteristics and craft to compose multiple texts that are meaningful. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

1D55779932A34B06B44642E63872EE12.description: publish written work for appropriate audiences.

BD4DC1A49353415B95437405332491D8.description: correct spelling, including commonly confused terms such as its/it's, affect/effect, there/their/they're, and to/two/too; and

973378A695A748CBA8602035FABD27C1.description: punctuation, including commas in nonrestrictive phrases and clauses, semicolons, colons, and parentheses; and

31C42A1A49E64412B489987719DAEB77.description: subordinating conjunctions to form complex sentences;

6773C879A53742A2A87B371FE915F943.description: prepositions and prepositional phrases and their influence on subject-verb agreement;

7377EF4F663E44ECB2DD2AD348067F42.description: consistent, appropriate use of verb tenses and active and passive voice;

5F217F7C47064512935F1E5220A4C06A.description: complete simple, compound, and complex sentences with subject-verb agreement and avoidance of splices, run-ons, and fragments;

5D574EC76E4A48E1A78433F99BA09778.description: edit drafts using standard English conventions, including:

57393994A16642C3BEC23AC4F168E49C.description: revise drafts for clarity, development, organization, style, word choice, and sentence variety;

B0B54BC55CC0465680FF0FE78BB0B948.description: developing an engaging idea reflecting depth of thought with specific facts, details, and examples;

098476D16F0A4B259D8AB753AAD9198E.description: organizing with purposeful structure, including an introduction, transitions, coherence within and across paragraphs, and a conclusion; and

27E9E018B055495C93DFBA7BE11F7A5E.description: develop drafts into a focused, structured, and coherent piece of writing by:

CB0D125928034C70A93E3945D31FB734.description: plan a first draft by selecting a genre appropriate for a particular topic, purpose, and audience using a range of strategies such as discussion, background reading, and personal interests;

0FB2AE4F330C48DFB666AB53A2164FF6.description: Composition: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--writing process. The student uses the writing process recursively to compose multiple texts that are legible and uses appropriate conventions. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

4D31376960FE46429DB39AC8FD272A80.description: explain the purpose of rhetorical devices such as analogy and juxtaposition and of logical fallacies such as bandwagon appeals and circular reasoning.

366EF0E15C294B4583E25B626C47CE55.description: analyze how the author's use of language contributes to the mood, voice, and tone; and

A3D589D55164415A9BB35F27FC63A43C.description: identify and analyze the use of literary devices, including multiple points of view and irony;

785E4B9C56C944DCACB6EB9A6E9C6755.description: describe how the author's use of figurative language such as extended metaphor achieves specific purposes;

B007A552AB2142C1AFE500E596CD319C.description: analyze the author's use of print and graphic features to achieve specific purposes;

84E3A83D116F427A89E439F01F91E131.description: analyze how the use of text structure contributes to the author's purpose;

3917B659FBB041F997C3538DF01B28A4.description: explain the author's purpose and message within a text;

3E5535F0A4B64E1A896AD847F81476A1.description: Author's purpose and craft: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. The student uses critical inquiry to analyze the authors' choices and how they influence and communicate meaning within a variety of texts. The student analyzes and applies author's craft purposefully in order to develop his or her own products and performances. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

29F39431A8294DB1A439F6A26F707E58.description: analyze characteristics of multimodal and digital texts.

50AA1B282B5B40219EA2D39C088EFED0.description: identifying the intended audience or reader; and

8B48D4ED816143C49EFFA783F3DE3D5F.description: identifying and explaining the counter argument; and

9A31947CB5C74BDD9F872AFB812EDC54.description: identifying the claim and analyzing the argument;

3FA3D6AFA7D14F81A6E40C31E5CF694D.description: analyze characteristics and structures of argumentative text by:

D493F2B9EC804FA194946DC173261EBA.description: multiple organizational patterns within a text to develop the thesis;

89AD46D1CE124211A9446BF4DFA198B2.description: features such as footnotes, endnotes, and citations; and

B003C26631A044AAB82203104CF95A2A.description: the controlling idea or thesis with supporting evidence;

4EAA3B3DF48E4408BAD521FD8904FC79.description: analyze characteristics and structural elements of informational text, including:

CA2259BD0D464FDC833092AD5AD9E3DA.description: analyze how playwrights develop dramatic action through the use of acts and scenes;

4C2152BAE471432B817839E995C005F6.description: analyze the effect of graphical elements such as punctuation and line length in poems across a variety of poetic forms such as epic, lyric, and humorous poetry;

2E56533D66164FE485DED89FBD18C5D0.description: identify structural elements such as rhyme, repetition, and alliteration and analyze how language contributes to the meaning of a poem;

1F7FAB6C19964BCFB377F818FB53F391.description: demonstrate knowledge of literary genres such as realistic fiction, adventure stories, historical fiction, mysteries, humor, fantasy, science fiction, and short stories;

96BBA7F559894C349E151ADE115095C5.description: Multiple genres: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--genres. The student recognizes and analyzes genre-specific characteristics, structures, and purposes within and across increasingly complex traditional, contemporary, classical, and diverse texts. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:Â

626EBC014E2449DBB566DFEB5FE4F5FA.description: explain how the setting influences the values and beliefs of characters.

72D9031E45354C939988E77E7CB229EE.description: analyze non-linear plot development such as flashbacks, foreshadowing, subplots, and parallel plot structures and compare it to linear plot development; and

7CDD53AAA8FC42C8B9DD36D309ABB5DD.description: analyze how characters' motivations and behaviors influence events and resolution of the conflict;

1621F130C7BB40E39F89A14E3DDDF466.description: analyze how themes are developed through the interaction of characters and events;

99667E740A2D47C181398749682FD3B3.description: Multiple genres: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts--literary elements. The student recognizes and analyzes literary elements within and across increasingly complex traditional, contemporary, classical, and diverse literary texts. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

507098D922894510A8A62AB9876CCC04.description: defend or challenge the claims using relevant text evidence.

AA08A55D5E0D455AA3641C95C571FB9D.description: reflect on and adjust responses as new evidence is presented; and

3C96F953153443F38FB6398EFF68EA1C.description: respond orally or in writing with appropriate register, vocabulary, tone, and voice;

67E5F410C36B4F9BA28A64C4E322AD71.description: discuss and write about the explicit or implicit meanings of text;

35A75A6AD086477C8C0BC8C03553E9B7.description: respond using newly acquired vocabulary as appropriate;

941DB0AFC8DF409C86C5C1E3B442BB85.description: interact with sources in meaningful ways such as notetaking, annotating, freewriting, or illustrating;

6C83D8D2B3DB4124B5A1DEFC5616D1CA.description: paraphrase and summarize texts in ways that maintain meaning and logical order;

6B8B4EDC9BBF476AB213E0F999E07512.description: use text evidence to support an appropriate response;

F953E5CD1ECD497CBFEB2DE8288D9E2E.description: write responses that demonstrate understanding of texts, including comparing sources within and across genres;

1F7901EF73424B20963318EBAFB54950.description: describe personal connections to a variety of sources, including self-selected texts;

3C5E572625154FDCBF85C9F12A27D86F.description: Response skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. The student responds to an increasingly challenging variety of sources that are read, heard, or viewed. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

78C2D942F3E2498A8316067BE99F7A27.description: monitor comprehension and make adjustments such as re-reading, using background knowledge, asking questions, and annotating when understanding breaks down.

1FE78AB450394BBBA6362D582067CFB2.description: synthesize information to create new understanding; and

FCA44A81ADC74717AF7EF4174F38D2F8.description: evaluate details read to determine key ideas;

B66E2C0A4A13405D96FA26DAF2C97AF9.description: make inferences and use evidence to support understanding;

9B297C5F03644498BEC6385B0F3A0CB8.description: make connections to personal experiences, ideas in other texts, and society;

B52F7BFE701449169CC78C7C03BE97EA.description: create mental images to deepen understanding;

3D1DC672B5154AA4A9EA7973C3C87370.description: make and correct or confirm predictions using text features, characteristics of genre, and structures;

E1BB28E8A4A84CF994A98FC9118A780F.description: generate questions about text before, during, and after reading to deepen understanding and gain information;

8EAB2513A5CB4E93B89AC326F7DA80F0.description: establish purpose for reading assigned and self-selected texts;

422C1422AD6A410FB48C6E7910760EC2.description: Comprehension skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking using multiple texts. The student uses metacognitive skills to both develop and deepen comprehension of increasingly complex texts. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

242A78B242234CE2BCCD19260F3112B7.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking--self-sustained reading. The student reads grade-appropriate texts independently. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to self-select text and read independently for a sustained period of time.

52425F1B71F8467393D53C55AAA67F1D.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking--fluency. The student reads grade-level text with fluency and comprehension. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to adjust fluency when reading grade-level text based on the reading purpose.

5FF7A250028C4538842E759886A2D884.description: investigate expressions such as idioms and word relationships such as antonyms, synonyms, and analogies.

6F277BC0DF2E4134AEA15839C053F8D6.description: use multiple-meaning words, homographs, homophones, and commonly confused terms correctly; and

40178FB228F04B208E66B9A38C8D6768.description: identify and use words that name actions, directions, positions, sequences, and locations;

496848F96DEC40FDB5EBE84FFC66F99B.description: determine the meaning and usage of grade-level academic English words derived from Greek, Latin, and other languages, including ast, qui, path, mand/mend, and duc; auto, bio, graph, meter, phon, port, and tele; and terr, chrono, audi, geo, dict, photo, and ject;

BF968AA79B1E4D1FB291F423729F9AD1.description: use context within or beyond a paragraph to clarify the meaning of unfamiliar or ambiguous words;

EFD7799BC1BC4F4E91FA48BD42F46FF6.description: use print or digital resources to determine the meaning, syllabication, pronunciation, word origin, and part of speech;

ED4594AA72BF4B1D93BBB9E2FFC28821.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking--vocabulary. The student uses newly acquired vocabulary expressively. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

D55DD3E38AC14542AAF2661F33DFBAE4.description: write complete words, thoughts, and answers legibly.

A3839FBE9D144A229E30A9F8389DEE46.description: demonstrate and apply phonetic knowledge; and

23DED45254D34E9CB13CD21861ECFDA5.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, reading, writing, and thinking--beginning reading and writing. The student develops word structure knowledge through phonological awareness, print concepts, phonics, and morphology to communicate, decode, and spell. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:

D3D7FBF42E2B4C75B86FA40793810962.description: develop social communication and produce oral language in contextualized and purposeful ways.

C267E5887C47430E90C4905FDB2CF834.description: participate collaboratively in discussions, plan agendas with clear goals and deadlines, set time limits for speakers, take notes, and vote on key issues; and

B03E4E9625D24A098E7447792309BB5F.description: advocate a position using anecdotes, analogies, and/or illustrations employing eye contact, speaking rate, volume, enunciation, a variety of natural gestures, and conventions of language to communicate ideas effectively;

303A8182C2584A549E2CFE654F8CB553.description: give an organized presentation with a specific point of view;

15AC56B1EE9B469497156D020C3A0ACC.description: follow, restate, and give complex oral instructions to perform specific tasks, answer questions, or solve problems;

7A6B0056C1634ACB83256A368077F177.description: listen actively to interpret a message by summarizing, asking questions, and making comments;

F06D9B6C3C2340018A5C3522846FC6B5.description: Developing and sustaining foundational language skills: listening, speaking, discussion, and thinking--oral language. The student develops oral language through listening, speaking, and discussion. Based on the student's language proficiency level, the student is expected to:
